message.content:
cs.NA, cs.DC, cs.MS, cs.CE, cs.SC 

Reasoning: 

- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper discusses the solution of boundary integral equations using a numerical method (hierarchical matrix approach) and presents performance results on a cluster equipped with GPUs. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper focuses on the scalability of the hierarchical matrix approach on multi-GPU clusters and discusses the implementation of a distributed-memory parallel library. 
- cs.MS (Mathematical Software): The paper presents an extension of an existing hierarchical matrix library (hmglib) to support multi-GPU clusters and arbitrary application codes. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper applies the hierarchical matrix approach to boundary element method (BEM) problems, which are commonly used in computational engineering and science. 
- cs.SC (Symbolic Computation): This category is less likely, but the paper does mention the use of adaptive cross approximation, which is a technique used in symbolic computation for approximating matrices.
